title: Jump Game for Emergency Response
scenario: You are developing a logistics algorithm for an emergency response team. The team is represented by an array where each element indicates the maximum distance they can jump to reach the next incident. Your goal is to determine if the team can reach the last incident location starting from the first.
task: Create an algorithm that checks if it is possible for the emergency response team to reach the last incident from the first index in the array, given the maximum jump distances.

examples.explanation: The team can jump from index 0 to index 1 (3), and then jump to index 4 (2), reaching the last incident.
From the first incident, the team can jump to the second location but cannot move to any further incident.
The team can jump from index 0 to index 1 (2) and then jump to index 4 (3), successfully reaching the last incident.

constraints: The input array will have at least one element.
The maximum length of the input array is 1000.
